A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Personally\, I really enjoyed this movie\, and I wish I went to see it more than once. As a Star Wars fan\, it gave new and unexpected turns where fan service could’ve been placed\, and adding more to the mythology and philosophy of the Force. My main issues lie in three pieces: most of the Casino Planet subplot (which was to build world and character but moreso distracted from the main plot and felt forced)\, Rose’s character (also pretty forced\, she could have been a lot more interesting and engaging)\, and how they treated Poe Dameron as a character in his seemingly teenage-esq. rebellion against General Holdo (which was also to build character\, but was\, in comparison\, a bit better than the Casino Planet). Other than those\, the film was rather spectacular. Luke’s sendoff\, Kylo and Rey’s development/connection\, the fight in Snoke’s chamber\, the final fight at the end of the film\, and the encroaching danger and future of the Rebellion were incredible. The scene with Leia flying through space could’ve been thrown out\, but it does add a new piece in the Star Wars lore\, albeit at an awkward time\, given Carrie Fisher’s recent passing. I look forward to see what comes next\, as The Last Jedi opens doors to new parts of the galaxy far\, far away.
